functional_requirements.description: The system must allow super admin users to create training courses, including course title, course description, course duration, etc.

functional_requirements.description: The system must allow authorized users to register basic information of trainers, including Name, Sex, Designation, Organization name, Subject specialization, Mobile_no, E-mail address, NID, etc.
functional_requirements.module_section_page: Basic Information Registration System of Trainer, Section 2.4, Page 8

functional_requirements.description: The system must allow authorized users to enter course enrollment information.
The system must provide a dashboard for authorized users to view summarized information and ongoing status.

The system must allow admin users to create users for head office, district, and upazilla offices of the Department of ICT, with roles assigned to users to perform tasks according to their permissions.
The system must send email notifications to trainees when they are nominated for training and provide updates via email.
The system must allow authorized users to generate reports, including trainee lists, trainer lists, attendance sheets, and other customized reports.

non_functional_requirements.description: The system must ensure access control and application-level security.
The system must incorporate a role-wise credential system for better user role management.
The system must encrypt user IDs and passwords, enforce minimum password lengths, and provide the ability to reset passwords following a standard password strategy.
non_functional_requirements.metrics_for_validation: Encryption audit, password policy compliance testing

non_functional_requirements.description: The system must provide a dashboard presenting dynamic data in reports with table and graphic presentations.
non_functional_requirements.metrics_for_validation: User acceptance testing for dashboard usability

non_functional_requirements.description: The system must support periodical and instant data backup and auto-archiving.
The system must be cross-browser compatible, responsive, and graphically attractive.
The system must support Bengali UNICODE-enabled fonts to properly display Bengali content on any machine that supports Unicode, and facilitate content display in both English and Bengali.
non_functional_requirements.metrics_for_validation: Unicode compliance testing, language rendering tests

non_functional_requirements.description: The system must be tested at module integration and load levels, with all necessary security tests at the application level architecture.
non_functional_requirements.metrics_for_validation: Integration testing, load testing, security testing

non_functional_requirements.description: The system must provide 24x7 online technical support as part of the SLA, including response, restoration, and remedy at the time of an incident, with incidents categorized based on severity level.
non_functional_requirements.metrics_for_validation: SLA compliance testing, incident response time tracking

non_functional_requirements.description: The system must support fixing all bugs and system errors identified by users during the support and maintenance phase.
non_functional_requirements.metrics_for_validation: Bug tracking and resolution time metrics

non_functional_requirements.description: The system must prioritize operations to fix errors that result in the application not operating or performing as expected.
The system must support timely backup of the entire database to meet challenges of system recovery in case of disasters or missing data.

The system must be supported by permanent support engineers assigned by the vendor, who work closely with clients/designated officials to ensure proper service delivery during the support and maintenance phase.
non_functional_requirements.metrics_for_validation: Support team assignment and performance reviews

non_functional_requirements.description: The vendor must ensure that programmers assigned to the project are not reassigned to other projects until completion, and continuity of work is maintained by other programmers in case of absence.
The hired IT personnel for support and maintenance must be regular employees of the vendor company.
The vendor must provide a monthly support and maintenance log report.
The system must adopt a microservice architecture to enable continuous delivery, better testability, deployability, and fault isolation, allowing independent development and scaling of services.
The system must be developed using an open-source development platform, with PHP-based tools like Bootstrap, frameworks like CakePHP/Laravel/CodeIgniter, and MySQL database.
The system must support future technology changes, iterative prototyping, and agility in product design.
The system must ensure compatibility with all well-known browsers on desktop, laptop, and smart devices.
The system must provide seamless communication with external software, including third-party services, payment gateways, database management systems, server OS, and web services.
